metadata.title: CVE-2016-10159 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the phar_parse_pharfile function in ext/phar/phar.c inPHP before 5.6.30 and 7.0.x before 7.0.15 allows remote attackers to causea denial of service (memory consumption or application crash) via atruncated manifest entry in a PHAR archive.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10159` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.0 - 7.0.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
libphp7.0-embed - 7.0.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
php7.0 - 7.0.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
php7.0-bcmath - 7.0.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.2

criterions.comment: php7.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
